task.title: Migrating HTML to DITA
task.abstract: You can use the DITA Open Toolkit to migrate HTML to DITA. The migration tools are located in the demo\h2d directory. The tools are updated version of the tools created by Robert D. Anderson and published on developerWorks in 2005.The "Related information" section contains links to the original developerWorks articles, which contain detailed information about these tools and how to extend them.

link.linktext: Migrating HTML to DITA, Part 1: Simple steps to move from HTML to DITA
link.desc: This is the first developerWorks article. The first of two parts, this article explains how to get a quick start with DITA using HTML topics that are already available. It shows you how to use the provided XSLT transform to do the migration and examines what is needed to ensure quality results.

link.linktext: Migrating HTML to DITA, Part 2: Extend the migration for more robust results
link.desc: This is the second developerWorks article. In Part 2 of this two-part series on how to quickly migrate HTML topics to DITA, the author explains the details of migration and shows you how to override parts of this process for ideal results.
